Authors: Subramanian K.G.; Isawasan P.; Venkat I.; Khader A.T.
Author full names: Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); Isawasan, Pradeep (35185056700); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Khader, Ahamad Tajudin (24724794600)
Title: Parikh matrices of words under a generalized Thue morphism
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Penang, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Penang, Malaysia; Isawasan P., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Penang, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Penang, Malaysia; Khader A.T., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Penang, Malaysia
Abstract: Parikh matrix of a word w, which is a sequence of symbols from an alphabet, was introduced by Mateescu et al. (2001) to count certain subwords in the word w. Subsequently, several investigations on various properties of Parikh matrices have been done. Parikh matrices of words that involve certain weak ratio-property are investigated by Subramanian et al (2009). On the other hand a morphism f is a mapping on words u,v whose images f(u), f(v) are also words with the property that f(uv) = f(u)f(v). Thue morphism on a binary alphabet is a special kind of morphism. Here we consider a generalization of Thue morphism, introduced by Seebold (2003) but restricting it to three symbols. We obtain certain properties of images of binary words under this generalized Thue morphism and also of their Parikh matrices, in the context of the weak ratio-property. © 2013 AIP Publishing LLC.
Author Keywords: Morphism; Parikh matrix; Subword; Word

Authors: Yusof U.K.; Budiarto R.; Venkat I.; Deris S.
Author full names: Yusof, Umi Kalsom (35085486700); Budiarto, Rahmat (58131692700); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Deris, Safaai (6602079797)
Title: Machine loading optimization in flexible manufacturing system using a hybrid of bio-inspired and musical-composition approach
Source title: Proceedings - 2011 6th International Conference on Bio-Inspired Computing: Theories and Applications, BIC-TA 2011
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, USM, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Faculty of Computer Science and Information System, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, 81310 Skudai, Johor, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Yusof U.K., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, USM, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Budiarto R., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, USM, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, USM, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Deris S., Faculty of Computer Science and Information System, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, 81310 Skudai, Johor, Malaysia
Abstract: Manufacturing industries are facing mere challenges in handling product competitiveness, shorter product cycle time and product varieties. The situation poses a need to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of capacity planning and resource optimization while still maintaining their flexibilities. Machine loading - one of the important components of capacity planning is known for its complexity that encompasses various types of flexibilities pertaining to part selection, machine and operation assignment along with constraints. Various studies are done to balance the productivity and flexibility in flexible manufacturing system (FMS). From the literature, the researchers have developed many approaches to reach a suitable balance of exploration (global improvement) and exploitation (local improvement). We adopt hybrid of population approaches; Hybrid Genetic Algorithm and Harmony Search algorithm (H-GaHs), to solve this problem that aims on mapping the feasible solution to the domain problem. The objectives are to minimize the system unbalance as well as increase throughput while satisfying the technological constraints such as machine time availability and tool slots. The proposed algorithm is tested for its performance on 10 sample problems available in FMS literature and compared with existing solution approaches. © 2011 IEEE.

Author full names: Syarifah Adilah, M.Y. (53985283400); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Abdullah, Rosni (7004462407); Yusof, Umi Kalsom (35085486700)
Title: Mass spectrometry analysis via metaheuristic optimization algorithms
Source title: Proceedings - 2011 6th International Conference on Bio-Inspired Computing: Theories and Applications, BIC-TA 2011
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti of Sciences Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Dept. of Computer Sciences and Matematics, Universiti Teknologi MARA Pulau Pinang, 13500 Penang, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Syarifah Adilah M.Y., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti of Sciences Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia, Dept. of Computer Sciences and Matematics, Universiti Teknologi MARA Pulau Pinang, 13500 Penang, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti of Sciences Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Abdullah R., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti of Sciences Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Yusof U.K., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti of Sciences Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia
Abstract: Biologically inspired metaheuristic techniques for exatracting salient features from mass spectrometry data has been recently gaining momentum among related fields of research viz., bioinformatics and proteomics. Such sophisticated approaches provide efficient ways to mine voluminous mass spectrometry data in order to extract potential features by getting rid of redundant information. This feature extraction process ultimately aids in discovering disease-related protein patterns in complex mixtures that is easily obtained from biological fluids such as serum and urine. This article provides an overview of such typical bio-inspired approaches. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Niu Y.; Subramanian K.G.; Venkat I.; Abdullah R.
Author full names: Niu, Yunyun (16643234400); Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Abdullah, Rosni (7004462407)
Title: A Tissue P system based solution to quadratic assignment problem
Source title: International Journal of Foundations of Computer Science
Affiliations: Key Laboratory of Image Processing and Intelligent Control, Department of Control Science and Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan 430074, China; School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Niu Y., Key Laboratory of Image Processing and Intelligent Control, Department of Control Science and Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan 430074, China; Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Abdullah R., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia
Abstract: The quadratic assignment problem (QAP) is one of the fundamental combinatorial optimization problems, which models many real-life problems. However, it is considered as one of the most difficult NP-hard problems, which means that no polynomial-time algorithm is known to solve this intractable problem effectively. Even small instances of QAP may require vast computation time. In this work, a uniform cellular solution to QAP is proposed in the framework of membrane computing by using a family of recognizer tissue P systems with cell division. In the design of the solution, we encode the given instances in binary notations. The paper can be considered as a contribution to the study of considering a binary encoding of the information in P systems. © 2012 World Scientific Publishing Company.
Author Keywords: cell division; Membrane computing; quadratic assignment problem; Tissue P system

Authors: Almazrooie M.; Abdullah R.; Yi L.Y.; Venkat I.; Adnan Z.
Author full names: Almazrooie, Mishal (56728629100); Abdullah, Rosni (7004462407); Yi, Lim Yun (56727435400); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Adnan, Zahraa (56418438200)
Title: Parallel Laplacian filter using CUDA on GP-GPU
Source title: Conference Proceedings - 6th International Conference on Information Technology and Multimedia at UNITEN: Cultivating Creativity and Enabling Technology Through the Internet of Things, ICIMU 2014
Affiliations: Universiti Sains Malaysia, Malaysia; College of Imam Azam University, Sunni Endowment Diwan, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Almazrooie M., Universiti Sains Malaysia, Malaysia; Abdullah R., Universiti Sains Malaysia, Malaysia; Yi L.Y., Universiti Sains Malaysia, Malaysia; Venkat I., Universiti Sains Malaysia, Malaysia; Adnan Z., College of Imam Azam University, Sunni Endowment Diwan, Malaysia
Abstract: Parallel programming has been extensively applied to different fields, such as medicine, security, and image processing. This paper focuses on parallelizing the Laplacian filter, an edge detection algorithm, using CUDA. We have conducted a performance analysis to benchmark the sequential Laplacian version against the CUDA parallel approach. Results show that the parallelization of Laplacian filter achieves better performance than sequential code. CUDA approach achieved 200 fold speedup for an image size of 50MB when 216 processing elements were deployed. © 2014 IEEE.

Authors: Venkat I.; De Wilde P.
Author full names: Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); De Wilde, Philippe (8275283600)
Title: Learning gait component relationships by fusing logic and graphs using Markov Logic Networks
Source title: 13th Conference on Information Fusion, Fusion 2010
Affiliations: School of Mathematical and Computer Sciences, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Authors with affiliations: Venkat I., School of Mathematical and Computer Sciences, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, United Kingdom; De Wilde P., School of Mathematical and Computer Sciences, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Abstract: Gait recognition is a newly developing biometric which has potential to recognize people at a distance when application of other biometrics might not be feasible. We propose a new technique to represent and learn various gait component relationships using a recently developing statistical relational learning technique called Markov Logic Networks. Markov Logic Network is a robust statistical learning technique that fuses expressive first-order logic with probabilistic graphical models and prove to be efficient in handling noisy and uncertain data. Initially we derive component based pattern classifiers in the imaging domain using an automatic segmentation scheme and represent gait components and their relationships using first-order logic. Then we model and learn their characteristics using undirected graphs to finally classify gaits based on standard inference techniques. The proposed approach enables automatic gait recognition from low resolution videos and differs from conventional techniques which rely on manual markings on videos. We show that the proposed representation provide intuitive means to reason gait component relationships. Our results show that the proposed approach competes well with other state-of-the-art techniques.
Author Keywords: Biometrics; Gait recognition; Logic-based fusion; Markov Logic Networks

Authors: Subramanian K.G.; Wiederhold P.; Venkat I.; Abdullah R.
Author full names: Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); Wiederhold, P. (55989662800); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Abdullah, Rosni (7004462407)
Title: Generative models for pictures tiled by triangles
Source title: Romanian Journal of Information Science and Technology
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Department of Automatic Control, Centro de Investigacíon Y de Estudios Avanzados (CINVESTAV-IPN), Col. San-Pedro Zacatenco, Mexico 07000 D.F., Av. I.P.N. 2508, Mexico
Authors with affiliations: Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Wiederhold P., Department of Automatic Control, Centro de Investigacíon Y de Estudios Avanzados (CINVESTAV-IPN), Col. San-Pedro Zacatenco, Mexico 07000 D.F., Av. I.P.N. 2508, Mexico; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Abdullah R., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia
Abstract: The problem of generation of triangle-tiled pictures that are two-dimensional figures tiled by isosceles right triangles of the same size, is investigated. Grammars called context-free triangle-tiled picture grammars (CF- ttPG) that generate such figures making use of context-free type rules, are proposed. The special case that all rules of such a grammar are regular, is studied. In the framework of membrane computing which is a biologically inspired computability model, generation of triangle-tiled pictures by rules of a CF-ttPG is considered. The picture language of rectangular hollow frames which cannot be generated by any CF-ttPG, can be generated by a specific type of P system with two membranes.
Author Keywords: Context-free grammar; Figure decomposed by triangles; P system; Picture generation by grammars; Picture grammar; Rectangular hollow frame; Triangle-tiled picture

Authors: Niu Y.; Venkat I.; Khader A.T.; Subramanian K.G.
Author full names: Niu, Yunyun (16643234400); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Khader, Ahamad Tajudin (24724794600); Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940)
Title: Uniform solution to common algorithmic problem in the minimally parallel mode
Source title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Affiliations: School of Electronic Engineering and Computer Science, Peking University, Beijing, 100871, China; School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Niu Y., School of Electronic Engineering and Computer Science, Peking University, Beijing, 100871, China; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Khader A.T., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia
Abstract: A P system is a novel computing model introduced by Păun in the area of membrane computing. It is known that the Common Algorithmic Problem (CAP) has a nice property that several other NP-complete problems can be reduced to it in linear time. The decision version of this problem is known to be efficiently solved with a family of recognizer P systems with active membranes with three electrical charges working in the maximally parallel way. We here work with a variant of a P system with active membranes that does not use polarizations and present a uniform solution to CAP in the minimally parallel mode. © Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg 2014.
Author Keywords: Common algorithmic problem; Membrane computing; Minimal parallelism; P system
Index Keywords: Computational complexity; Bioinformatics; Computation theory; Common algorithmic problems; Decision version; Electrical charges; Maximally parallel; Membrane computing; Minimal parallelism; P systems; Recognizer P systems; Active membranes; Bioinformatics; Algorithms

Authors: Ibrahim A.M.; Venkat I.; Wilde P.D.
Author full names: Ibrahim, Azhar Mohd (57198461699); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Wilde, Philippe De (8275283600)
Title: The impact of potential crowd behaviours on emergency evacuation: An evolutionary game-theoretic approach
Source title: JASSS
Affiliations: Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Kuala Lumpur, 53100, Malaysia; School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia USM, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; School of Computing, University of Kent, Canterbury, CT2 7NZ, Kent, United Kingdom
Authors with affiliations: Ibrahim A.M., Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Kuala Lumpur, 53100, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia USM, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Wilde P.D., School of Computing, University of Kent, Canterbury, CT2 7NZ, Kent, United Kingdom
Abstract: Crowd dynamics have important applications in evacuation management systems relevant to organizing safer large scale gatherings. For crowd safety, it is very important to study the evolution of potential crowd behaviours by simulating the crowd evacuation process. Planning crowd control tasks by studying the impact of crowd behaviour evolution towards evacuation could mitigate the possibility of crowd disasters. During a typical emergency evacuation scenario, conflict among agents occurs when agents intend to move to the same location as a result of the interaction with their nearest neighbours. The effect of the agent response towards their neighbourhood is vital in order to understand the effect of variation of crowd behaviour on the whole environment. In this work, we model crowd motion subject to exit congestion under uncertainty conditions in a continuous space via computer simulations. We model best-response, risk-seeking, risk-averse and risk-neutral behaviours of agents via certain game-theoretic notions. We perform computer simulations with heterogeneous populations in order to study the effect of the evolution of agent behaviours towards egress flow under threat conditions. Our simulation results show the relation between the local crowd pressure and the number of injured agents. We observe that when the proportion of agents in a population of risk-seeking agents is increased, the average crowd pressure, average local density and the number of injured agents increases. Besides that, based on our simulation results, we can infer that crowd disasters could be prevented if the agent population consists entirely of risk-averse and risk-neutral agents despite circumstances that lead to threats. © 2019, University of Surrey. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Crowd disaster; Evacuation model; Evolution of crowd behaviour; Evolutionary game theory
Funding Details: LRGS, (203/PTS6728001); Ministry of Higher Education, Malaysia, MOHE, (1001/PKOMP/811290); Universiti Sains Malaysia; International Islamic University Malaysia, IIUM

Title: Binary image reconstruction based on prescribed numerical information
Source title: Acta Mathematicae Applicatae Sinica
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia (USM), Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Networked Computing Center, Surya University, Serpong, Tanggerang, 15810, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia (USM), Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Isawasan P., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia (USM), Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Budiarto R., Networked Computing Center, Surya University, Serpong, Tanggerang, 15810, Indonesia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia (USM), Penang, 11800, Malaysia
Abstract: The problem of reconstruction of a binary image in the field of discrete tomography is a classic instance of seeking solution applying mathematical techniques. Here two such binary image reconstruction problems are considered given some numerical information on the image. Algorithms are developed for solving these problems and correctness of the algorithms are discussed. © 2015, Institute of Applied Mathematics, Academy of Mathematics and System Sciences, Chinese Academy of Sciences and Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg.

Authors: Alsalibi B.; Venkat I.; Subramanian K.G.; Christinal H.
Author full names: Alsalibi, Bisan (56596818100); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); Christinal, Hepzibah (55931833300)
Title: A bio-inspired software for homology groups of 2D digital images
Source title: Proceedings - Asian Conference on Membrane Computing, ACMC 2014
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Department of Mathematics, Karunya University Coimbatore, Tamilnadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Alsalibi B., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Christinal H., Department of Mathematics, Karunya University Coimbatore, Tamilnadu, India
Abstract: Computational topology within the context of digital imagery has gained a considerable role in several applications like structural pattern recognition and digital image processing. Membrane computing, which is a new computational model inspired from the structure and functioning of biological cells, has been adapted as a rich framework for handling many problems. In this paper, we present a membrane computing software for automatically computing homology groups of 2D digital images in a logarithmic number of steps. © 2014 IEEE.

Authors: Venkat I.; Khader A.T.; Subramanian K.G.
Author full names: Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Khader, Ahamad Tajudin (24724794600); Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940)
Title: Pedestrian dynamics via Bayesian networks
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11700 Pulau Pinang, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11700 Pulau Pinang, Malaysia; Khader A.T., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11700 Pulau Pinang, Malaysia; Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11700 Pulau Pinang, Malaysia
Abstract: Studies on pedestrian dynamics have vital applications in crowd control management relevant to organizing safer large scale gatherings including pilgrimages. Reasoning pedestrian motion via computational intelligence techniques could be posed as a potential research problem within the realms of Artificial Intelligence. In this contribution, we propose a "Bayesian Network Model for Pedestrian Dynamics" (BNMPD) to reason the vast uncertainty imposed by pedestrian motion. With reference to key findings from literature which include simulation studies, we systematically identify: What are the various factors that could contribute to the prediction of crowd flow status? The proposed model unifies these factors in a cohesive manner using Bayesian Networks (BNs) and serves as a sophisticated probabilistic tool to simulate vital cause and effect relationships entailed in the pedestrian domain. © 2014 AIP Publishing LLC.
Author Keywords: Bayesian networks; Crowd disaster; Crowd evacuation; Directed acyclic graphs; Pedestrian dynamics
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Dynamics; Bayesian network models; Bayesian Networks (bns); Cause-and-effect relationships; Computational intelligence techniques; Crowd disaster; Crowd evacuation; Directed acyclic graph (DAG); Pedestrian dynamics; Bayesian networks

Authors: Siddique M.T.; Venkat I.; Kasem A.; Tazrajiman S.
Author full names: Siddique, Muhammad Tariq (57201840220); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Kasem, Asem (15020788300); Tazrajiman, Sharul (58071193500)
Title: An Automatic Photometric Augmentation Technique to Recognize Faces with Single Sample Per Person
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Gadong, Brunei Darussalam
Authors with affiliations: Siddique M.T., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Gadong, Brunei Darussalam; Venkat I., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Gadong, Brunei Darussalam; Kasem A., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Gadong, Brunei Darussalam; Tazrajiman S., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Gadong, Brunei Darussalam
Abstract: The problem of face recognition gets more challenging when only a single face image per person is available. Further variations encountered in unconstrained scenarios impose more intricacies to the recognition mechanism such as illumination, pose, occlusion, expression and, so on. In this paper, we propose an augmentation technique that combines a set of photometric augmentation techniques to increase the training samples. A face embedding from the augmented face images is extracted using the classical FaceNet deep learning model. Furthermore, an SVM-based classifier has been deployed to recognize faces. Our results show that the proposed technique yields result on a par with the state-of-the-art methods. © 2023 American Institute of Physics Inc.. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: AUGMENTATION; FACE RECOGNITION; FACENET; SINGLE SAMPLE PER PERSON; SVM

Authors: Romlay M.R.M.; Ibrahim A.M.; Toha S.F.; De Wilde P.; Venkat I.
Author full names: Romlay, Muhammad Rabani Mohd (57193570858); Ibrahim, Azhar Mohd (57198461699); Toha, Siti Fauziah (19934557200); De Wilde, Philippe (8275283600); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000)
Title: Novel CE-CBCE feature extraction method for object classification using a low-density LiDAR point cloud
Source title: PLoS ONE
Affiliations: Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia; University of Kent, Canterbury, United Kingdom; School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Jalan Tunku Link Gadong, Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei Darussalam
Authors with affiliations: Romlay M.R.M., Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia; Ibrahim A.M., Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia; Toha S.F., Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia; De Wilde P., University of Kent, Canterbury, United Kingdom; Venkat I., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Jalan Tunku Link Gadong, Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei Darussalam
Abstract: Low-end LiDAR sensor provides an alternative for depth measurement and object recognition for lightweight devices. However due to low computing capacity, complicated algorithms are incompatible to be performed on the device, with sparse information further limits the feature available for extraction. Therefore, a classification method which could receive sparse input, while providing ample leverage for the classification process to accurately differentiate objects within limited computing capability is required. To achieve reliable feature extraction from a sparse LiDAR point cloud, this paper proposes a novel Clustered Extraction and Centroid Based Clustered Extraction Method (CE-CBCE) method for feature extraction followed by a convolutional neural network (CNN) object classifier. The integration of the CE-CBCE and CNN methods enable us to utilize lightweight actuated LiDAR input and provides low computing means of classification while maintaining accurate detection. Based on genuine LiDAR data, the final result shows reliable accuracy of 97% through the method proposed. © 2021 Mohd Romlay et al. Authors: Zali M.N.; Ibrahim A.M.; Venkat I.; Omar S.; Belaton B.
Author full names: Zali, Muhamad Naim (58071280200); Ibrahim, Azhar Mohd (57198461699); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Omar, Saiful (57191927058); Belaton, Bahari (6504014356)
Title: Crowd Management: Simulation Modelling and Visualization Via Fuzzy Agents
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Selangor, Gombak, 53100, Malaysia; School of Computing & Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Gadong, 1410, Brunei Darussalam; School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pulau Pinang, 11800, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Zali M.N., Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Selangor, Gombak, 53100, Malaysia; Ibrahim A.M., Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Selangor, Gombak, 53100, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computing & Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Gadong, 1410, Brunei Darussalam; Omar S., School of Computing & Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Gadong, 1410, Brunei Darussalam; Belaton B., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pulau Pinang, 11800, Malaysia
Abstract: Simulation of crowd dynamics plays an essential role to understand crowd behavior and thus could help crowd management authorities in the process of organizing safer and broader events. The purpose of this study is to model, simulate and visualize crowd dynamics applicable to emergency situations via human-like intelligent agents governed by the rules of fuzzy-logic. At the micro level the crowd is perceived as a group of individual agents (pedestrians). During an emergency situation each agent’s goal is to evacuate through an exit. This study cohesively deploys fuzzy-logic based control mechanisms to determine the degree of emergency level pertaining to each agent in the crowd. Further, Unity based simulation and visualization models are proposed to display critical areas of the crowd during a typical evacuation process. Results justify the fact that the evacuation time taken shows significant increments proportional to the population size of the agents while the percentage of emergency level portrays quite similar trends. © 2023 American Institute of Physics Inc.. All rights reserved.

Authors: Maghari A.Y.A.; Venkat I.; Liao I.Y.; Belaton B.
Author full names: Maghari, Ashraf Y. A. (55419644100); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Liao, Iman Yi (23060943300); Belaton, Bahari (6504014356)
Title: Reconstructing 3D face shapes from single 2D images using an adaptive deformation model
Source title: Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pinang, Malaysia; School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Maghari A.Y.A., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pinang, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pinang, Malaysia; Liao I.Y., School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus, Malaysia; Belaton B., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pinang, Malaysia
Abstract: The Representational Power (RP) of an example-based model is its capability to depict a new 3D face for a given 2D face image. In this contribution, a novel approach is proposed to increase the RP of the 3D reconstruction PCA-based model by deforming a set of examples in the training dataset. By adding these deformed samples together with the original training samples we gain more RP. A 3D PCA-based model is adapted for each new input face image by deforming 3D faces in the training data set. This adapted model is used to reconstruct the 3D face shape for the given input 2D near frontal face image. Our experimental results justify that the proposed adaptive model considerably improves the RP of the conventional PCA-based model. © 2013 Springer International Publishing.

Authors: Seng V.L.K.; Wan A.T.; Venkat I.; Patchmuthu R.K.; Ali S.H.M.
Author full names: Seng, Vincent Lew Kok (58765232400); Wan, Au Thien (57205359898); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Patchmuthu, Ravi Kumar (58647865800); Ali, Serina Hj Mohd (58764808800)
Title: Blockchain technology in securing academic credentials: Mobile QR block CV
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Jalan Tungku Link, Mukim Gadong A, BE1410, Brunei Darussalam
Authors with affiliations: Seng V.L.K., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Jalan Tungku Link, Mukim Gadong A, BE1410, Brunei Darussalam; Wan A.T., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Jalan Tungku Link, Mukim Gadong A, BE1410, Brunei Darussalam; Venkat I., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Jalan Tungku Link, Mukim Gadong A, BE1410, Brunei Darussalam; Patchmuthu R.K., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Jalan Tungku Link, Mukim Gadong A, BE1410, Brunei Darussalam; Ali S.H.M., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Jalan Tungku Link, Mukim Gadong A, BE1410, Brunei Darussalam
Abstract: Certificates, diplomas, ever since their inception have been used as a measure of an individual's abilities and qualifications. Fake degrees or document frauds can have disastrous consequences, from short-term reputational damage to loss of trust in the educational industry. This paper presents a developed prototype that uses a hybrid proof-of-authority blockchain network to securely record curriculum vitae data and combat fake degrees or document frauds using QR Block CV. It is also developed following the agile SDLC to be a native Xamarin. Forms mobile application on the Ethereum platform that functions as an interface for users to interact with the blockchain network, sharing CVs via QR code, allowing for better accessibility.  © 2023 Author(s).

Authors: Ibrahim A.M.; Venkat I.; Khader A.T.
Author full names: Ibrahim, Azhar Mohd (57198461699); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Khader, Ahamad Tajudin (24724794600)
Title: Simulation modelling and analysis of crowd evacuation by utilizing evolutionary stable strategy
Source title: ICIC Express Letters
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Universiti Sains Malaysia USM, Penang, 11800, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Ibrahim A.M., School of Computer Science, Universiti Sains Malaysia USM, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Science, Universiti Sains Malaysia USM, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Khader A.T., School of Computer Science, Universiti Sains Malaysia USM, Penang, 11800, Malaysia
Abstract: Crowd and evacuation management has been active areas of research and study in the recent past. Various developments continue to take place in the process of eﬃcient evacuation of crowd in mass gatherings. This article is intended to provide an analysis on crowd evacuation models based on the game theory approach. There will be interaction among evacuees in which the evacuees tend to be either cooperator or defector in order to move towards desired path. This paper analyzes in detail the pure and mixed strategy of Nash Equilibrium (NE) and Evolutionary Stable Strategy (ESS) as a result of diﬀerent types of interaction among evacuees under diﬀerent scenarios that possibly could happen during normal and emergency evacuation. We found out that due to the higher cost of interrupting than the value of beneﬁt able to move, the proportion of defectors playing the ESS will decrease compared to the proportion of cooperators playing the ESS. © 2016 ICIC International.
Author Keywords: Evacuation simulation; Evolutionary stable strategy; Game theory

Authors: Subramanian K.G.; Isawasan P.; Venkat I.; Pan L.; Nagar A.
Author full names: Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); Isawasan, Pradeep (35185056700); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Pan, Linqiang (7402393930); Nagar, Atulya (8840681600)
Title: Array P systems with permitting features
Source title: Journal of Computational Science
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Department of Control Science and Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan 430074, Hubei, China; Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, Liverpool Hope University, Liverpool L16 9JD, United Kingdom

Abstract: The biologically inspired model, known as P system, has proved to be a general framework for investigating several problems related to computing in different fields. Two-dimensional picture array languages is one such area in which different kinds of P systems have been constructed for picture array generation. Incorporating the feature of permitting symbols in the rules, a new variety of array P system is constructed here for generating picture languages consisting of picture arrays. The advantage of this approach is that there is a reduction in the number of membranes used in the construction, in comparison to the existing array P system models. © 2013 Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Array P system; Membrane computing; Picture language
Index Keywords: Computation theory; Computer science; Computer simulation; Array generation; Array languages; Biologically inspired models; Membrane computing; P systems; Picture languages; Bioinformatics

Authors: Isawasan P.; Muniyandi R.C.; Venkat I.; Subramanian K.G.
Author full names: Isawasan, Pradeep (35185056700); Muniyandi, Ravie Chandren (14030355800); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940)
Title: Array-rewriting P systems with basic puzzle grammar rules and permitting features
Source title: Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)
Affiliations: Department of Computing, School of Engineering, Computing and Built Environment, KDU Penang University College, George Town, 10400, Penang, Malaysia; School of Computer Science, Faculty of Information Science and Technology, Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Bangi, 43600, Malaysia; School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Gelugor, 11800, Penang, Malaysia; Department of Mathematics, Madras Christian College, Tambaram, Chennai, 600059, India
Authors with affiliations: Isawasan P., Department of Computing, School of Engineering, Computing and Built Environment, KDU Penang University College, George Town, 10400, Penang, Malaysia; Muniyandi R.C., School of Computer Science, Faculty of Information Science and Technology, Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Bangi, 43600, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Gelugor, 11800, Penang, Malaysia; Subramanian K.G., Department of Mathematics, Madras Christian College, Tambaram, Chennai, 600059, India
Abstract: Motivated by the problem of tiling the plane, puzzle grammars were introduced as a mechanism for generating languages of picture arrays in the two-dimensional plane. On the other hand BPG array P system with array objects and basic puzzle grammar (BPG) rules was introduced as a variant of array generating P systems that were developed with a view to link the two areas of membrane computing and picture array grammars. Here we incorporate the feature of permitting symbols in the rules of the BPG array P system, thus introducing permitting array P system with BPG rules (pAP(BPG)). We show that the permitting feature gives more generative power to the BPG array P system with one or two membranes. We also show that a pAP(BPG) with only two membranes under t–communication mode, can generate picture arrays of square frames. © Springer International Publishing AG 2017.
Index Keywords: Membranes; Array grammar; Communication mode; Grammar rules; Membrane computing; P systems; Rewriting P systems; Square frame; Two dimensional plane; Bioinformatics

Authors: Venkat I.; Robinson T.; Subramanian K.G.; de Wilde P.
Author full names: Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Robinson, Thamburaj (36702280500); Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); de Wilde, Philippe (8275283600)
Title: Generation of kolam-designs based on contextual array P systems
Source title: Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800, Penang, Malaysia; Department of Mathematics, Madras Christian College, Tambaram, Chennai, 600059, India; University of Kent, Canterbury, United Kingdom
Authors with affiliations: Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800, Penang, Malaysia; Robinson T., Department of Mathematics, Madras Christian College, Tambaram, Chennai, 600059, India; Subramanian K.G., Department of Mathematics, Madras Christian College, Tambaram, Chennai, 600059, India; de Wilde P., University of Kent, Canterbury, United Kingdom
Abstract: Kolam-designs are diagrams used to decorate the floor, especially in front of a house in South India. Methods of generation of the kolam diagrams were developed based on two-dimensional picture generating models, broadly known as array grammars, introduced for the description and analysis of picture patterns. Rewriting array P system, a membrane computing model based on array rewriting has been developed to evolve picture arrays, based on context-free array rewriting rules. In contrast to this array P system, another P system model called contextual array P system (CAP) using contextual array rules for the evolution or generation of picture arrays has been proposed and its power in generating picture arrays investigated. Here we develop an application of CAP for the generation of the kolam diagrams. The advantage of using CAP is that kolam diagrams that cannot be handled by array grammars can be generated by the CAP model. © Springer International Publishing AG, part of Springer Nature 2018.
Author Keywords: Array grammars; Array P system; Contextual array rules; Floor-designs; Kolam patterns
Index Keywords: Computation theory; Floors; Array grammar; Context-free; Contextual array rules; Generating models; Kolam patterns; Membrane computing; P systems; Rewriting rules; Graphic methods

Authors: Mohd Ibrahim A.; Venkat I.; Wilde P.D.
Author full names: Mohd Ibrahim, Azhar (57198461699); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Wilde, Philippe De (8275283600)
Title: Uncertainty in a spatial evacuation model
Source title: Physica A: Statistical Mechanics and its Applications
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, USM Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Kuala Lumpur, 53100, Malaysia; University of Kent, Canterbury, United Kingdom
Authors with affiliations: Mohd Ibrahim A., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, USM Penang, 11800, Malaysia, Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Jalan Gombak, Kuala Lumpur, 53100, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, USM Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Wilde P.D., University of Kent, Canterbury, United Kingdom
Abstract: Pedestrian movements in crowd motion can be perceived in terms of agents who basically exhibit patient or impatient behavior. We model crowd motion subject to exit congestion under uncertainty conditions in a continuous space and compare the proposed model via simulations with the classical social force model. During a typical emergency evacuation scenario, agents might not be able to perceive with certainty the strategies of opponents (other agents) owing to the dynamic changes entailed by the neighborhood of opponents. In such uncertain scenarios, agents will try to update their strategy based on their own rules or their intrinsic behavior. We study risk seeking, risk averse and risk neutral behaviors of such agents via certain game theory notions. We found that risk averse agents tend to achieve faster evacuation time whenever the time delay in conflicts appears to be longer. The results of our simulations also comply with previous work and conform to the fact that evacuation time of agents becomes shorter once mutual cooperation among agents is achieved. Although the impatient strategy appears to be the rational strategy that might lead to faster evacuation times, our study scientifically shows that the more the agents are impatient, the slower is the egress time. © 2017 Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Evolution of crowd behavior; Game theory; Spatial evacuation model; Uncertainty
Index Keywords: Game theory; Risk analysis; Continuous spaces; Crowd behavior; Emergency evacuation; Evacuation modeling; Intrinsic behavior; Pedestrian movement; Social force models; Uncertainty; Behavioral research

Abstract: A P system model, called Contextual array P system, that makes use of array objects and contextual array rules, is introduced and its generative power in the description of picture arrays is examined, by comparing it with certain other array generating devices. © 2012 Springer-Verlag.

Authors: Mohd Ibrahim A.; Venkat I.; De Wilde P.; Mohd Romlay M.R.; Bahamid A.
Author full names: Mohd Ibrahim, Azhar (57198461699); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); De Wilde, Philippe (8275283600); Mohd Romlay, Muhammad Rabani (57193570858); Bahamid, Alala (57216333027)
Title: The role of crowd behavior and cooperation strategies during evacuation
Source title: Simulation
Affiliations: Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Malaysia; School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Brunei Darussalam; Division of Natural Sciences, University of Kent, United Kingdom
Authors with affiliations: Mohd Ibrahim A., Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computing and Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Brunei Darussalam; De Wilde P., Division of Natural Sciences, University of Kent, United Kingdom; Mohd Romlay M.R., Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Malaysia; Bahamid A., Department of Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Malaysia
Abstract: Crowd dynamics have constituted a hotspot of research in recent times, particularly in areas where developmental progress has taken place in crowd evacuation for ensuring human safety. In high-density crowd events which happen frequently, panic or an emergency can lead to an increase in congestion which may cause disastrous incidents. Crowd control planning via simulation of people’s movement and behavior can promote safe departures from a space, despite threatening circumstances. Up until now, the evolution of distinctive types of crowd behavior towards cooperative flow remains unexplored. Hence, in this paper, we investigate the impact of potential crowd behavior, namely best-response, risk-seeking, risk-averse, and risk-neutral agents in achieving cooperation during evacuation and its connection with evacuation time using a game-theoretic evacuation simulation model. We analyze the crowd evacuation of a rectangular room with either a single-door or multiple exits in a continuous space. Simulation results show that mutual cooperation during evacuation can be realized when the agents’ population is dominated by risk-averse agents. The results also demonstrate that the risk-seeking agents tend toward aggressiveness by opting for a defector strategy regardless of the local crowd densities, while other crowd behavior shows cooperation under high local crowd density. © The Author(s) 2022.

Authors: Subramanian K.G.; Isawasan P.; Venkat I.; Pan L.
Author full names: Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); Isawasan, Pradeep (35185056700); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Pan, Linqiang (7402393930)
Title: Parallel array-rewriting P systems
Source title: Romanian Journal of Information Science and Technology
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Key Laboratory of Image Information Processing and Intelligent Control, School of Automation, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, Hubei, China
Authors with affiliations: Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Isawasan P., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Pan L., Key Laboratory of Image Information Processing and Intelligent Control, School of Automation, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, Hubei, China
Abstract: A variant of array-rewriting P systems that uses parallel rewriting of arrays in the regions is introduced. The generative power of this model is compared with certain array grammars generating array languages. It is shown that geometric arrays such as hollow rectangles and hollow squares can be generated by parallel array P systems with a priority relation on the rules. The advantage of the proposed variant is that the number of membranes necessary for generating certain array language is reduced in the constructions as array generation devices.
Author Keywords: Array grammar; Array P system; Parallel rewriting; Two-dimensional array
Funding Details: National Natural Science Foundation of China, (61033003, 61320106005, 91130034)

Authors: Maghari A.Y.A.; Venkat I.; Liao I.Y.; Belaton B.
Author full names: Maghari, Ashraf Y.A. (55419644100); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Liao, Iman Yi (23060943300); Belaton, Bahari (6504014356)
Title: PCA-based reconstruction of 3D face shapes using tikhonov regularization
Source title: International Journal of Advances in Soft Computing and its Applications
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pinang, Malaysia; School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Maghari A.Y.A., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pinang, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pinang, Malaysia; Liao I.Y., School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus, Malaysia; Belaton B., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pinang, Malaysia
Abstract: Reconstructing a 3D face shape from a limited number of 2D facial feature points is considered as an ill-posed problem which can be solved using regularization. Tikhonov regularization is a popular method that incorporates prior information towards providing the existence of closed-form solutions which we obtain as a result of applying PCA, in order to solve the ill-posed problem. The common factors that generally affect Tikhonov regularization are the regularization matrix, the number of feature points, regularization parameters and noise. In this study we report our findings on how various factors influence the reconstruction accuracy based on a case study performed on the USF Human ID 3D database. Further, a statistical comparison between two Tikhonov regularization matrices viz., the identity matrix and the diagonal matrix comprising of the eigenvalues (eigenvalue matrix), has been performed. We found that, the reconstruction error can be reduced significantly by using the later one. Finally our study aids to determine the most feasible interval in conjunction with optimal regularization parameters which would lead towards achieving accurate and plausible solutions. © SCRG Publication, 2013.
Author Keywords: 3D face reconstruction; PCA; Tikhonov regularization

Authors: Vijaya N.; Rajan B.; Venkat I.

Title: Crossing numbers of join of a graph on six vertices with a path and a cycle
Source title: International Journal of Advances in Soft Computing and its Applications
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics, Alpha College of Engineering, Chennai, 600 124, India; Research and Development Centre, Bharathiar University, Coimbatore, 621 026, India; Department of Mathematics, Loyola College, Chennai, 600 034, India; School of Mathematical and Physical Sciences, Faculty of Science and IT, The University of Newcastle, 2308, NSW, Australia; School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Vijaya N., Department of Mathematics, Alpha College of Engineering, Chennai, 600 124, India, Research and Development Centre, Bharathiar University, Coimbatore, 621 026, India; Rajan B., Department of Mathematics, Loyola College, Chennai, 600 034, India, School of Mathematical and Physical Sciences, Faculty of Science and IT, The University of Newcastle, 2308, NSW, Australia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, Malaysia
Abstract: The crossing number of a graph G is the minimum number of crossings of its edges among the drawings of G in the plane and is denoted by cr(G). Zarankiewicz conjectured that the crossing number of the complete bipartite graph Km,n. equals This conjecture has been verified by Kleitman for min (m, n) ≤ 6. Using this result, we give the exact values of crossing number of the join of a certain graph G on six vertices with a path and a cycle on n vertices.
Author Keywords: Crossing Number; Good drawing of a graph; Union and join of graphs

Authors: Alsalibi B.; Venkat I.; Subramanian K.G.; Lutfi S.L.; De Wilde P.
Author full names: Alsalibi, Bisan (56596818100); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); Lutfi, Syaheerah Lebai (27567802400); De Wilde, Philippe (8275283600)
Title: The impact of bio-inspired approaches toward the advancement of face recognition
Source title: ACM Computing Surveys
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; University of Kent, United Kingdom
Authors with affiliations: Alsalibi B., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Lutfi S.L., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; De Wilde P., University of Kent, United Kingdom
Abstract: An increased number of bio-inspired face recognition systems have emerged in recent decades owing to their intelligent problem-solving ability, flexibility, scalability, and adaptive nature. Hence, this survey aims to present a detailed overview of bio-inspired approaches pertaining to the advancement of face recognition. Based on a well-classified taxonomy, relevant bio-inspired techniques and their merits and demerits in countering potential problems vital to face recognition are analyzed. A synthesis of various approaches in terms of key governing principles and their associated performance analysis are systematically portrayed. Finally, some intuitive future directions are suggested on how bio-inspired approaches can contribute to the advancement of face biometrics in the years to come. © 2015 ACM 0360-0300/2015/08-ART5 $15.00.
Author Keywords: Artificial neural networks; Bio-inspired computing; Evolutionary algorithms; Face recognition; Feature selection; Optimization; Swarm intelligence

Authors: Subramanian K.G.; Venkat I.; Csuhaj-Varjú E.
Author full names: Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Csuhaj-Varjú, Erzsébet (7003395443)
Title: On the power of permitting features in cooperating context-free array grammar systems
Source title: Discrete Applied Mathematics
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Department of Algorithms and Applications, Faculty of Informatics, Eötvös Loránd University, Budapest, Hungary
Authors with affiliations: Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Csuhaj-Varjú E., Department of Algorithms and Applications, Faculty of Informatics, Eötvös Loránd University, Budapest, Hungary
Abstract: Among many grammar models for picture description, cooperating context-free distributed array grammar systems utilize the mechanism of cooperation between component array grammars. Here, we endow these grammar systems with the feature of permitting symbols, and examine the generative capacity of the resulting permitting cooperating context-free distributed array grammar systems with certain other kinds of isometric and non-isometric array grammars. An advantage is that the number of components is reduced when this permitting feature is used in a cooperating context-free distributed array grammar system. © 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Array grammar systems; Array grammars; Generative models; Picture arrays; Two-dimensional languages
Index Keywords: Combinatorial mathematics; Array grammar; Distributed arrays; Generative capacity; Generative model; Grammar systems; Number of components; Picture arrays; Two-dimensional languages; Mathematical techniques
Funding Details: Ministry of Higher Education, Malaysia, MOHE
Funding Texts: The comments of the reviewers have been of great help in revising the paper and to make a better presentation of the ideas. The authors are grateful to the referees for their time spent and for their useful comments. The first and second authors gratefully acknowledge support from an FRGS grant No. 203/PKOMP/6711267 of the Ministry of Higher Education, Malaysia .

Authors: Azazi A.; Lutfi S.L.; Venkat I.
Author full names: Azazi, Amal (56606204300); Lutfi, Syaheerah Lebai (27567802400); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000)
Title: Analysis and evaluation of SURF descriptors for automatic 3D facial expression recognition using different classifiers
Source title: 2014 4th World Congress on Information and Communication Technologies, WICT 2014
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pulau Pinang, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Azazi A., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pulau Pinang, Malaysia; Lutfi S.L., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pulau Pinang, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pulau Pinang, Malaysia
Abstract: Emotion recognition plays a vital role in the field of Human-Computer Interaction (HCI). Among the visual human emotional cues, facial expressions are the most commonly used and understandable cues. Different machine learning techniques have been utilized to solve the expression recognition problem; however, their performance is still disputed. In this paper, we investigate the capability of several classification techniques to discriminate between the six universal facial expressions using Speed Up Robust Features (SURF). The evaluation were conducted using the BU-3DFE database with four classifiers, namely, Support Vector machine (SVM), Neural Network (NN), k-Nearest Neighbors (k-NN), and Naïve Bayes (NB). Experimental results show that the SVM was successful in discriminating between the six universal facial expressions with an overall recognition accuracy of 79.36%, which is significantly better than the nearest accuracy achieved by Naïve Bayes at significance level p < 0.05. © 2014 IEEE.

Title: Region-based segmentation of Hexagonal digital images using membrane computing
Source title: Proceedings - Asian Conference on Membrane Computing, ACMC 2014
Affiliations: Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Karunya University, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, 641 114, India
Authors with affiliations: Isawasan P., Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Venkat I., Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Subramanian K.G., Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Khader A., Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Osman O., Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Christinal H., Karunya University, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, 641 114, India
Abstract: P system is a distributed and parallel computing model in membrane computing, processing multisets of symbol objects in a localized manner. This computational model has proved to be a robust framework for modelling a variety of situations arising in very different areas, for instance, investigation of problems related to digital images. In this paper, we develop a P system for handling region-based segmentation of two-dimensional hexagonal digital images motivated by a corresponding model for rectangular digital images and point out the utility of these P systems for segmenting groups of crowds. © 2014 IEEE.

Authors: Boraik A.N.; Abdullah R.; Venkat I.
Author full names: Boraik, Aziz Nasser (56287921600); Abdullah, Rosni (7004462407); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000)
Title: Detect Anchor Points by Using Shared Near Neighbors for Multiple Sequence Alignment
Source title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Boraik A.N., School of Computer Science, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Malaysia; Abdullah R., School of Computer Science, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Science, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Malaysia
Abstract: The Multiple sequence alignment (MSA) is a fundamental step for almost all aspects of biological sequence analysis. The reliability and accuracy of sequence analyses depend on the quality of MSA. Including anchor points into multiple sequence alignment to be aligned has been proved to be a good way to increase the quality of MSA. In this paper, we have applied Shared Near Neighbors method to construct the anchor points as partial alignment columns which will be aligned for final output. These anchor points can be used as guide with DIALIGN-TX method to overcome the limitation of DIALIGN-TX to increase the accuracy of final MSA. The results showed 4-8% improvement in the six reference sets in BAliBASE 3.0 benchmark regarding to CS score compared to DIALIGN-TX. In addition, it achieved the highest overall mean Q-score and CS score comparing to other MSA methods in IRMBASE 2.0 benchmark. © Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg 2013.
Author Keywords: anchor points; multiple sequence alignment; protein sequences; shared near neighbors

Authors: Agarwal H.; Raman B.; Venkat I.
Author full names: Agarwal, Himanshu (55371838100); Raman, Balasubramanian (23135470700); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000)
Title: Blind reliable invisible watermarking method in wavelet domain for face image watermark
Source title: Multimedia Tools and Applications
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee, 247667, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee, 247667, India; School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Pulau Pinang, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Agarwal H., Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee, 247667, India; Raman B., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee, 247667, India; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Pulau Pinang, Malaysia
Abstract: In this paper, we have combined watermarking and biometrics for possible improvement in owner identification/verification technology. We have proposed and compared wavelet based four blind invisible watermarking methods that have used face image as watermark. Two watermarking methods are based on the discrete wavelet transform (DWT) and rest two watermarking methods are based on the redundant discrete wavelet transform (RDWT). One watermarking method in each transform incorporates weighted binary coding to achieve improved reliability of extracted watermark. Other watermarking methods replace original image coefficients with face image coefficients. We have observed that DWT based watermarking methods outperform RDWT based watermarking methods. We have compared the robustness of the proposed watermarking methods against various common image processing attacks/operations. We have observed that DWT based watermarking method coupled with weighted binary coding has the best performance without attacks; peak signal to noise ratio value of watermarked image is greater than 50 dB and normalized correlation coefficient value of extracted watermark is 1 at the watermark embedding strength of 1. Moreover, the same watermarking method has the best robustness against most of the attacks. © 2014, Springer Science+Business Media New York.

Authors: Isawasan P.; Venkat I.; Muniyandi R.C.; Subramanian K.G.
Author full names: Isawasan, Pradeep (35185056700); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Muniyandi, Ravie Chandren (14030355800); Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940)
Title: A membrane computing model for generation of picture arrays
Source title: Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Gelugor, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; School of Computer Science, Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Bangi, 43600, Malaysia; Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, Liverpool Hope University, Hope Park, Liverpool, L16 9JD, United Kingdom
Authors with affiliations: Isawasan P., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Gelugor, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Gelugor, Penang, 11800, Malaysia; Muniyandi R.C., School of Computer Science, Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Bangi, 43600, Malaysia; Subramanian K.G., Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, Liverpool Hope University, Hope Park, Liverpool, L16 9JD, United Kingdom
Abstract: In the bio-inspired area of membrane computing, P system is a versatile model providing a rich framework for many computational problems. Array P system and its variant with parallel rewriting facilitate the study of picture languages within this area of membrane computing. Here another variant of array P system, called tabled parallel array P system (TPAP), is introduced, by endowing it with the features of parallel rewriting and tables of array-rewriting rules. The generative power of TPAP as well as the ability of this system in describing picture patterns are investigated. © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2015.
Author Keywords: Bio-inspired computing; Membrane computing; P system; Picture language
Index Keywords: Computational linguistics; Information science; Bio-inspired computing; Computational problem; Membrane computing; P systems; Parallel arrays; Picture languages; Rewriting rules; Bioinformatics

Authors: Tan J.S.; Venkat I.; Belaton B.
Author full names: Tan, Joi San (57005878300); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Belaton, Bahari (6504014356)
Title: An analytical curvature B-spline algorithm for effective curve modeling
Source title: Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pulau Pinang, 11800, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Tan J.S., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pulau Pinang, 11800, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pulau Pinang, 11800, Malaysia; Belaton B., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Pulau Pinang, 11800, Malaysia
Abstract: This paper presents a new algorithm based on an analytical approach for generating non-uniform cubic B-spline which has potential applications in curve modeling. For a given set of data points, knot vectors are computed using the centripetal approach. Next, number of data points is assimilated around the high curvature areas and the parametrization aspect is computed by the inverse chord length with the new set of data points. Second order derivatives are used to determine the high curvature areas of the curves. The method proposed here enables to construct the curves smoothly around high curvature areas by assigning adequate number of data points for the B-splines. Experimental validations justify the fact that the average curve fitting error yielded by the proposed approach is the lowest when compared to other standard curve models. © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2015.
Author Keywords: Centripetal method; Inverse chord length; Non-uniform cubic B-spline; Second order derivative
Index Keywords: Algorithms; Information science; Interpolation; Inverse problems; Ship propellers; Analytical approach; Centripetal method; Chord lengths; Cubic B -spline; Experimental validations; Number of datum; Parametrizations; Second order derivatives; Curve fitting

Authors: Subramanian K.G.; Hemalatha S.; Venkat I.
Author full names: Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); Hemalatha, S. (57214605281); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000)
Title: On watson-crick automata
Source title: ACM International Conference Proceeding Series
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Department of Mathematics, S.D.N.B. Vaishnav College, Chennai 600044, India
Authors with affiliations: Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Hemalatha S., Department of Mathematics, S.D.N.B. Vaishnav College, Chennai 600044, India; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia
Abstract: Motivated by Watson-Crick automata, we introduce here a grammar counterpart called a Watson-Crick regular grammar that has rules as in a regular grammar but involves double stranded strings. The language generated by this grammar consists of strings in the upper strands of the double stranded strings related by a complementarity relation. We obtain some properties of these grammars and also indicate an application to generation of chain code pictures. Copyright © 2012 ACM.

Authors: Isawasan P.; Venkat I.; Subramanian K.G.; Sarmin N.H.
Author full names: Isawasan, Pradeep (35185056700); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Subramanian, K.G. (7202235940); Sarmin, Nor Haniza (24725760500)
Title: Morphic images of binary words and Parikh matrices
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Penang, Malaysia; Department of Mathematical Science, Faculty of Science, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, 81310 UTM, Johor Bharu, Johor, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Isawasan P., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Penang, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Penang, Malaysia; Subramanian K.G., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 USM, Penang, Malaysia; Sarmin N.H., Department of Mathematical Science, Faculty of Science, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, 81310 UTM, Johor Bharu, Johor, Malaysia
Abstract: A word is a finite sequence of symbols. Parikh matrix of a word, introduced by Mateescu et al (2000), has become an effective tool in the study of certain numerical properties of words based on subwords. There have been several investigations on various properties of Parikh matrices such as M-ambiguity, M-equivalence, subword equalities and inequalities, commutativity and so on. Recently, Parikh matrices of words that are images under certain morphisms have been studied for their properties. On the other hand, Parikh matrices of words involving a certain ratio property called weak-ratio property have been investigated by Subramanian et al (2009). Here we consider two special morphisms called Fibonacci and Tribonacci morphisms and obtain properties of Parikh matrices of images of binary words under these morphisms, utilizing the notion of weak-ratio property. © 2014 AIP Publishing LLC.
Author Keywords: Binary word; morphism; parikh matric; subword

Authors: Romlay M.R.M.; Toha S.F.; Ibrahim A.M.; Venkat I.
Author full names: Romlay, Muhammad Rabani Mohd (57193570858); Toha, Siti Fauziah (19934557200); Ibrahim, Azhar Mohd (57198461699); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000)
Title: Methodologies and evaluation of electronic travel aids for the visually impaired people: A review
Source title: Bulletin of Electrical Engineering and Informatics
Affiliations: Department Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Malaysia; School of Computing & Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Brunei Darussalam
Authors with affiliations: Romlay M.R.M., Department Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Malaysia; Toha S.F., Department Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Malaysia; Ibrahim A.M., Department Mechatronics Engineering, International Islamic University Malaysia, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computing & Informatics, Universiti Teknologi Brunei, Brunei Darussalam
Abstract: Technological advancements have widely contributed to navigation aids. However, their large-scale adaptation for navigation solutions for visually impaired people haven’t been realized yet. Less participation of the visually impaired subject produces a designer-oriented navigation system which overshadows consumer necessity. The outcome results in trust and safety issues, hindering the navigation aids from really contribute to the safety of the targeted end user. This study categorizes electronic travel aids (ETAs) based on experimental evaluations, highlights the designer-centred development of navigation aids with insufficient participation of the visual impaired community. First the research breaks down the methodologies to achieve navigation, followed by categorization of the test and experimentation done to evaluate the systems and ranks it by maturity order. From 70 selected research articles, 51.4% accounts for simulation evaluation, 24.3% involve blindfolded-sighted humans, 22.9% involve visually impaired people and only 1.4% makes it into production and commercialization. Our systematic review offers a bird’s eye view on ETA development and evaluation and contributes to construction of navigational aids which really impact the target group of visually impaired people. © 2021, Institute of Advanced Engineering and Science. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Autonomous mobile robot; Electronic travel aids; LiDAR point cloud
Funding Details: UMP-IIUM-UiTM, (IRAGS18-014-0015); International Islamic University Malaysia, IIUM

Authors: Maghari A.Y.A.; Venkat I.; Liao I.Y.; Belaton B.
Author full names: Maghari, Ashraf Y.A. (55419644100); Venkat, Ibrahim (36338095000); Liao, Iman Yi (23060943300); Belaton, Bahari (6504014356)
Title: Effect of training sample on reconstructing 3D face shapes from feature points
Source title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Affiliations: School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, Malaysia; School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham, Malaysia Campus, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Maghari A.Y.A., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, Malaysia; Venkat I., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, Malaysia; Liao I.Y., School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham, Malaysia Campus, Malaysia; Belaton B., School of Computer Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, Malaysia
Abstract: Statistical learning models are recognized as important emerging methodologies in the area of data reconstruction. The learning models are trained from a set of examples to reach a state where the model will be able to predict the correct output for other examples. PCA-based statistical modeling is a popular technique for modeling 3D faces, which can be used for 3D face reconstruction. The capability of 3D face leaning models in depicting new 3D faces can be considered as the representational power (RP) of the model. This paper focuses on examining the effect of the sample size (number of training faces) on the accuracy of the 3D face shape reconstruction from a small set of feature points. It also aims to visualize the effect of the training sample size on the RP of PCA-based models. Experiments were designed and carried out on testing and training data of the USF Human ID 3D database. We found that although the representational power increases with a larger training sample size, the accuracy of reconstruction is limited by the number of the feature points used. This means that by reconstructing faces from a limited number of feature points, a definite number of examples are sufficient to build a satisfactory 3D face model. © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2013.
Author Keywords: 3D face reconstruction; PCA; Regularization; Sample size; Statistical face modeling
Index Keywords: Face recognition; Information technology; Sampling; 3D face reconstruction; Face modeling; PCA; Regularization; Sample sizes; Three dimensional
